Key Arguments: The submission argues that the legislation is a step towards tyranny and undermines free speech.
It suggests that the government and corporate entities have been engaging in disinformation campaigns, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The author believes that social media platforms have been censoring dissenting views and that alternative platforms have been suppressed.
The submission expresses concern over the erosion of rights and freedoms in Australia over the decades.
The author draws parallels between current government actions and historical examples of propaganda and tyranny, such as those seen in Nazi Germany.
Main Themes: Distrust of global institutions and elites
Notable Quotes: "This weaponisation of government should not be present or even tolerated in an open and free society, and certainly not in any nation that likes to call itself 'democratic'."

"I view this Communications Legislation Amendment (Combatting Misinformation and Disinformation) 2023 as just another step towards the tyranny we in Australia have come to expect from our governments and 'installed' representatives of global forces."
"Did we not learn anything from our two world wars, particularly World War II and the legislation the Nazi Party imposed on the people of Germany and elsewhere in Europe?"
